The only people who might find this sort of crap funny are the people who won't see it anyway because they either can't find the cinema, or get sidetracked licking windows.0.0000001/10

Honestly if you're thinking about watching this go watch "Anus Magillicutty" instead. At least that film had some redeeming qualities. This "film" is to cinema what Hitler was to the Jews. In future decades when people look back and saw that this movie came out and people actually went to see it they'll regard us the same way we regard cultures that believed stars were burning vents on giant chariot wheels pilot by the Gods. This film had no jokes. Picture going to see a stand-up comedian who's act was saying "remember smurfs, remember snorks, remember superman" that's basically what you get here, except this has even more irreverent pop culture references than a Shrek movie. Ignore this garbage.

You know it's a parody in the end so don't take it very personal the movie is bad because they are making to much of this kind the plot is very poor, they "make fun" of too many movies, maybe a 12 y/o can laugh at this but only if he understands and have seen all they movies that they are making fun of. This is going out of hand I miss those old movies with the legend Leslie Nielsen etc. maybe they where cheese but I have laughed at every single one of them every time I have watched them. So, go and watch other movies guys, if you want parodies or a fun comedy i recommend the old ones, even though some of them has bad CGI (amazing for their time though) but you can laugh at that too.

How did these writers/directors ever get a job in Hollywood after this disaster? These are some of the worst writers in the business!!! I thought Will Ferrell movies were bad, these writers make him look like an Oscar winner for best actor & his movies best picture!!! This needs pulled from everything & destroyed!!!

Well, let me start by saying its a damn shame that IMDb doesn't allow a 0 rating- there has never been a stronger contender in my opinion. The mere fact that this movie has been produced is a testament to the idea that there are actually idiots born every second. It's upsetting to think that the makers of this horrific film must be making a profit to keep creating this bile. I think that it shows how bad this film is when i look back on watching it and feel Carmen Electra lowered herself from Meet the Spartans by appearing in this film. Whats really shameful, on top of all other factors, is that the best joke with this apparent 'comedy' is the irony found in the title where the movie itself is described rather than the events that follow.

Well of all the spoofs I've ever seen this has to be the worst.... ill give meet the Spartans or w/e a better rating than this and that was total rubbish....Acting was terrible so many obvious mistakes low budget rubbish... Just a few words i can use without getting kicked off the site for profane language.... This isn't even worth sleeping through....Scary movie wasn't bad now that was a funny spoof... but after that they just went downhill.... I mean a lot of ppl will go to see this cos they like spoofs but i don't think i laughed once this whole movie... Total waste of time in fact.... I didn't even finish watching this movie it was so bad started playing with my phone....Don't watch this rubbish you would have to be totally retarded to even think about watching this... Well i got to be honest the title fits disaster movie cos its a complete disaster hence "Epic Fail"....Id really like to get hold of the writer/s, director, producer/s and just give them all a slap to the face for this movie..... I mean come on i like a good spoof but from this pond scum dirt worm of a movie I'm never gonna watch another one.... stop reading this review its a waste of time... in fact I'm gonna stop writing now....
Holy moly this movie... I got the stomach flu after watching this, and I don't think it was a coincidence. Please... I beg you please... Don't watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Loop this movie on a TV monitor in a prison gas chamber
reviews.content: The only thing great about a movie like this is that it inspires fantastic reviews from the IMDb users. You guys are great. It reminds me that there are still some insightful people left who still care about good art (yes, film is still an art). I saw this movie with an 11-year-old (which was mainly the reason why I was watching it in the first place) and guess what? He didn't laugh either. That disappointed me, because if he had enjoyed himself then at least I could say I watched it for a good reason.The worst part about your IMDb reviews is that they are probably entertaining Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, who I'm sure are sitting back reading these articles and laughing at us allwhich is more than they deserve from us, because they have never made any of us laugh even once.If the filmmakers ARE reading this, then I urge you to watch Airplane and Naked Gun again. Learn from your masters, Zucker and Abraham. Learn from the Farrelly Brothers. Learn from Mike Judge. Bow to them and admit that you are their inferior bitches. They will spit on you in return, and you're barely worth that.

The title says it all, it's a DISASTER MOVIE😂
Just one of those cash-in movies that would mash up all Pop Culture references, bad acting and lame jokes.

reviews.review_title: Finally a movie with a title that makes sense!
reviews.content: In many ways Disaster Movie is like Ronseal. It does exactly what it says on the tin. The movie is a disaster. It makes you cringe and cry far more than making you laugh. To keep with the 'ronseal feel' the acting is horribly wooden. The whole whole thing is a mess.When are these spoof movies going to end? None have produced laughs! Date movie, Superhero Movie, Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans are all way below average. with the exception of Superhero movie they are all under 3/10 rated on this very site!Friedberg and Seltzer should both be banned from the movie industry. I never want to see anything made by them. They know of one genre, pathetic.I admit I did not see all of this film. I like many other people at the cinema with me walked out before the end. Even with the two for one offer on tickets, I wish I didn't pay. Its part of my life I will never get back. I could've had more fun castrating myself.
This is the greatest disaster spoof ever, this movie is not ****ed-up!!

There aren't enough negative words in the dictionary to adequately describe how awful this movie was. No plot. No continuity. The writers seem to think profanity is a valid substitute for witty dialogue. The only disaster was that this movie was released on an unsuspecting public. But wait! There's more. We had the ultimate awkward experience! Not only were we subjected to one of the world's worst movies, but the star and a large group of his family & friends happened to be seated in front of us and next to us. We wanted to walk out on the movie, but how do you tell the star's aunt, "Oh, sorry. Your nephew is really cute, but nothing he does can save this total piece of crap. We're out of here!" At least my husband learned a valuable lesson from this experience - if the movie title contains the word "movie"... don't waste your money! Run, don't walk, away from this movie as fast as you can!

reviews.review_title: You Call This Funny? I Call It A Waste Of 88 Minutes(1/2* Out Of ****)
reviews.content: Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are the new writing duo on the scene and probably one of the more famous writing teams but for all of the wrong reasons. They are known for writing and directing some of the worst films I have ever seen. Who could forget the soon to be Academy Award Winning classics Epic Movie or Date Movie and of course Meet The Spartans. All of them terribly Unfunny. Then comes Disaster movie, 1 of 3 films written by the duo to come out in the year 2008. The first being the awful Meet The Spartans, the second being Superhero Movie which believe it or not is actually really funny, and the third being this. This makes me ponder the question: Why on earth do people find this funny. It may say from 2 of the 6 writers of Scary Movie but look, there were 6 writers for Scary Movie. How do these two untalented unfunny writers keep getting work? Just because they wrote Scary Movie doesn't mean they can transfer their work into movies like this.25-year-old Will played by Matt Lanter is getting ready for his Sweet 16 birthday party because he never had one. His girlfriend Amy played by Vanessa Lachey is having a rocky relationship with Will but gives him one more chance. Wills friend Calvin played by Gary Johnson along with his girlfriend Lisa played by Kim Kardashian throw Will a great party filled with a High School Musical song and dance number. However the party is cut short by meteors falling down to earth. Will, Amy, Calvin, Lisa and Juno played by Crista Flannigan Try to find Shelter until the shower is finished. They come across colorful characters along the way like the crew form Sex And The City, Batman and the princess from Enchanted.Now the movie actually, believe it or not, has a few funny moments in it. The Dr. Phil and Hancock Impersonators are pretty funny and Tony Cox has a really funny cameo as Indiana Jones and has the best written dialouge in the film. Now the rest of the film is not funny at all. What Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer find funny is the useless contrived potty humor and of course the ever funny gay jokes. This movie can't go five minutes without cracking a gay joke. There is a scene in the film where the character of Will is tackled by a naked Beowoulf. Ha-Ha.There are two songs in the film. The first song which is the High School Musical song. Listen to these soon-to-be-classic lyrics: "We'll All be friends forever, Unless a random Disaster Destroys the city". Ha Ha. Also we have the song I'm F****** Matt Damon, Again HA-HA. Half of the stuff in this film made me say What was the joke? For example, when Hannah Montana Gets crushed by a boulder but she keeps dying and coming back to life. Whats The Joke? Maybe I don't understand it but apparently other people did because this movie made money. Why, I don't know. Now I love stupid humor, one of my favorite films of all time is Napoleon Dynamite but wow this movie is bad. I am going to use a term from the online film critic duo Schmoes Know, This movie Stoinks!Wow! This is one of the worst films I have ever seen. This movie is not funny. It is poor and unfunny it is tedious to watch. I Hated Hated Hated Hated Hated This Movie. It has insulted the Intelligence of not only me and the intelligence of cinema but it has insulted the intelligence of the American people. Shame on you anybody who payed money to see this movie in theaters.Rated PG-13 For Crude And Sexual Content Throughout, Language, Drug References And Comic Violence.Theatrical: 1hr 27min/87min. Unrated: 1hr 28min/88min.Theatrical: 1 use of the F-word. Unrated: 60 uses of the F-word.1/2*/****

dude, i completely agree with the first comment there, these movies were OK when they were done by the Wayans bros. Warning! Major spoilers ahead!"Disaster Movie" is a marked improvement over Seltzer and Friedburg's "Date" and "Epic Movie". They pick and choose which movies to parody thoroughly, and which are simply two-second cameos (an example would be "Iron Man", the title character of which is flattened into a tin can---literally---only a few seconds after his arrival). Their care and caution certainly pays off in a mostly hilarious film that satisfies those tired of the same summer blockbuster garbage or overrated indie art-house junk. Perhaps people do not like the Selter-Friedburg movies because they eschew subtlety altogether and "tell" rather than "show" why they are parodying a particular movie or celebrity. Still, it was fun to see art-house darling "Juno" literally torn to shreds (I did not see "Juno", but Seltzer/Friedburg let me know what the character of the original was like by mocking her dialogue) by demonic Muppet chipmunks. Finally, Seltzer and Friedburg do good by killing off the sadistic villain from that overrated indie gore-fest "No Country For Old Men". And what's not to like about a gratuitous girl fight between two very beautiful women, Kim Kardashian and Carmen Electra? In short: the directors were judicious in what they chose to parody, the actors (especially the versatile Nicole Parker) did very well (Kim Kardashian was not too terrible to watch as a first-timer), and the carnivorous, devilish, cheap-looking chipmunk puppets kept me gasping for air with laughter. It's far from the worst movie ever, and those courageous enough to brave the critics' venom will find quite a treat.

That was just cringey.Total waste of time, the plot is set around Cloverfield which was a terrible movie in itself.

reviews.review_title: Disaster Movie Sets A Title For Itself
reviews.content: By my count, there are at least 25 movies referenced in "Disaster Movie," the latest abominable train wreck engineered by the untalented hacks who excreted "Date Movie," "Epic Movie," and "Meet the Spartans." Note that I do not say "Disaster Movie" spoofs or satirizes 25 movies -- only that it refers to them.You and I know that mentioning something is not the same thing as spoofing it. (We also know that spoofing is not the same as satirizing, but that's a discussion for another day.) Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, who write and direct these films as a duo, do not know this. In their minds, all it takes to spoof "The Incredible Hulk" is for the character to show up and then be crushed by a falling cow.Get it?! It's a character you recognize from a different movie, but here he is in THIS movie! And then he gets hurt! The title notwithstanding, disaster movies are not the object of "Disaster Movie's" satire (such as it is). You're thinking "The Towering Inferno," "The Poseidon Adventure," or "The Day After Tomorrow"; they're thinking "Sex and the City," "You Don't Mess with the Zohan," and "Juno" -- any movie that came out within the last year, in other words. The film's basic structure parallels "Cloverfield" (which sort of qualifies), and there's a reference to "Twister" -- from 12 years ago -- and the only joke is that a tornado keeps throwing cows around. But other than that, "Disaster Movie" is really nothing more than an ill-conceived, unfunny series of weak, talent-show-at-summer-camp-level skits.Just Disastrous.

reviews.review_title: The short and to the point review of "Disaster Movie"
reviews.content: It f*cking sucks!Well, there needs to be 10 lines of text. Damn.Anyway, well what can I say about this movie? Not much more since the point has already been stated. But seriously, do not ever go see this movie. At all. This movie will suck the soul right out of your body!The movie is basically a big parody of Cloverfield and it spoofs Twister in there somewhere and the only way the main characters can stop the horrible events is to return the crystal skull back to it's alter. Oh, I get it! It parodies two movies at once! That's really not that funny!The movie is more or less a character starts walking around, notices something happening and then another character comes in and and notices what's happening says one line and you never see them in the movie again. Then another character comes in and sees another character and says "Whoa, Oh My God blah blah blah blah!" and then another character says a line and doesn't appear in the movie. Insert recycled "joke" here and then repeat.So, does that sound at all GOOD to you? If so, go see it, but I just hope you know that I already dislike you. The only way anyone will enjoy this movie is if they go see it with a funny friend or something and make witty comments throughout the whole movie.Friedberg & Seltzer are the two reasons I would like to bring back public hangings. That may sound harsh, but this sh*tstain of a movie p*ssed me off more than anything because this movie makes you feel like you just got f**ked in the a*s for $8.50 for 90 minutes straight. That should be illegal. Well, it is illegal, but they didn't make it illegal for movies, and IT SHOULD BE!Well, that's enough of my rants.-Eric

Nothing in Disaster Movie works. The actors don't even try, the jokes are the worst I have ever heard, the effects are painful to watch, the parodies are horrible, everything fails. The jokes are extremely unfunny, random at times, often don't feel like they have punch lines, and they go forever. In a film that is less than an hour and a half the jokes should not all be a minute long. When a joke is told the film feels like you just hit pause. The film stops, tells the very long and terrible joke, and when it is over and the film moves on it just stops again for another bad joke just seconds later. The parodies are unfunny, random at times, and make me feel horrible. All the jokes in the film are either physical (unfunny) or parody (very unfunny). A parody is meant to make someone laugh about something they've seen. This makes parodies the wrong way. Instead of making fun and at the same time honoring the thing being parodied Disaster Movie does neither of those two things. It doesn't honor anything. It doesn't make fun of much. The parodies are just there. The parodies most of the time are just the character from another movie saying that they are that character and then the character gets hurt. This is due to the parodies being made from trailers of the movies. Friedberg and Seltzer give a bad name to parodies when there is a lot of good parodies. Now to due this and other films under the same two directors the parody genre should retire. In the end Disaster Movie is a true disaster.0 stars out of 4Also an MJ molesting joke in 2008. At the time MJ jokes hadn't been considered funny for years. The was just failure to realize a change in humor.

If I could give this film zero out of 10 stars, I would have. In fact, even zero may be too generous. Problem 1: A successful movie, even a spoof or parody, needs to have an actual plot, and this one doesn't. Problem 2: A successful movie cannot be made by stringing together 90 minutes of tired pop-culture references, lame celebrity impersonations, grotesque sexual innuendo, ridiculous sight gags, mindless profanity, and bad jokes. Problem 3: A successful movie needs more than the cheesiest acting since a 1970's After-School Special, and the worst script since "Plan 9 From Outer Space." Problem 4: Jokes you can see coming from a mile away only work if they are actually funny.

reviews.review_title: Truly, pathetically, bizarrely awful. But we can learn from it.
reviews.content: OK, let's get it out of the way early: this movie is truly bad. Granted, I didn't think it was as bad as 'Epic Movie,' but that may just be because I had not seen the equal of 'Epic Movie' in a long time ('Chairman of the Board' springs to mind). But don't think I am praising it: 'Epic Movie' was a pile of dog excrement. 'Disaster Movie' is tinsel in the dog excrement: shinier, a little more attractive, but in the end, pretty much just as disgusting.For those who don't know, the plot of this tripe is, essentially, several fairly attractive young people try to make it through a Friedberg/Seltzer movie with their careers intact. Unfortunately, no one's does, which is a bit of a shame: Carmen Electra, for her crazy past, certainly deserves a lot better, and the only real bright spot of the film, the deadpan work by Ike Barinholtz of Mad TV fame (who had the only semi-decent line in 'Meet the Spartans') is underpinned by a boatload of utter nonsense. Attempts to further the plot are foiled by an endless stream of pop culture references that are not only unfunny, but have nothing to do with anything that happens on screen. And just in case you aren't laughing at a joke (believe me, it will be through no fault of your own), the filmmakers make absolutely certain you know exactly what they are referencing and why you should find it funny.But all is not lost. Thankfully, even the worst movies can teach us a thing or two about what works and what doesn't. Since this movie has shown that some people clearly haven't learned them (and budding filmmakers, take note), let's print a few here: 1. IN COMEDY, TIMING IS EVERYTHING. Somehow, cosmically, every joke has its one point where it switches from 'ho-hum' to 'gutbuster.' Some jokes take longer, some shorter. But playing a 1 second joke for 5 minutes does not work. For reference, see much of this movie.2. EDITING IS CRUCIAL. Similar to #1 in idea, but different in execution. One of the questions the movie asks is, 'Why not use five gags to make one joke?' The reason: four of the gags are not funny, and by the time the fifth rolls around, the joke falls flat on its face. I really think some of the gags in the movie could work if some editing was done. Unfortunately, this would most likely reduce the running time considerably...say, to about 27 minutes or so.3. DON'T INSULT THE AUDIENCE. Toilet humor is perfectly fine for a movie, especially a parody film. I can laugh at pretty much anything. But as I mentioned above, I don't laugh when I'm told by the movie why this scene is supposed to be funny, and that I should laugh specifically because it told me I should. I liked 'Superhero Movie,' because as incredibly stupid and silly as it was, it never once told me to laugh at something; it let me decide. 'Disaster Movie' never gives you the option. Every joke is carefully (and sometimes, quite thoroughly) explained, to the point where I wanted to shout out, "All right! I get it, but I don't like it!" 4. SEQUELS AND SPIN-OFFS ARE WRITTEN THROUGH DOLLARS. Any dollar spent at the local theater, rental store, or on-line distributor is a vote for that film. If you don't like something, for Pete's sake, don't spend your hard-earned money on it. And tell your friends not to see it. It would appear after 'Disaster,' the audience is finally starting to speak where it counts the most.No movie is completely without fans. If you liked 'Disaster Movie,' then you liked it. But please, keep it to yourself. I've painfully sat through the last three Seltzer/Friedberg movies so others wouldn't have to. Do not make my sacrifice in vain.

This is the only film i've seen that i'd give 0/10 to, if i could.There's no plot so no point commenting on that. The film's nothing but a series of unfunny, stale gags and pop culture references, in the hope of finding a laugh somewhere. reviews.review_title: Disaster by name, DISASTER by nature
reviews.content: Disaster Movie is supposed to be a 'comedy' feature film. It is agony to say this film possesses any humour whatsoever. 90 minutes of sheer torture. It is nothing more than a 'copy and paste' hash of other movies that bares no relevance to the title. The more people who boycott such films will send a clear message to the studios that we'd rather spend our money on going to see a film that's worth paying for. Hit them in their wallets and they'll soon get the message.

This movie is so boring and stupid at the same time. Not a good funny movie, jokes not funny, I mean, all of it are not that funny as Scary Movie

As I've said before, you need to have a great sense of humor in order to appreciate and like these types of movies! I really liked Disaster Movie and thought it was just as good as Date Movie, Epic Movie, and Meet the Spartans! They make fun of a lot of stuff like 10,000 B.C., Cloverfield, Super Sweet 16, Iron Man, Incredible Hulk, Sex and the City, Juno, Alvin and the Chipmunks, Enchanted, Kung Fu Panda, Superbad, The Dark Knight, and much more! Will has a dream that the world will end on August 29, 2008! As he's throwing his 'Super Duper Sweet 16' party, the disasters start happening. Will, Calvin, Lisa, and Juno escape to save Amy. Later, they find Princess Giselle. I thought it was funny when they started break-dancing and Juno was break-dancing on her pregnant belly! (Crista Flanagan was awesome as Juno, she was my favorite character!) Thought it was cool when Alvin and the Chipmunks started singing Heavy Metal music! Another part I liked was when they were making fun of Superbad and the guy kept saying "I am McLover" over and over again! Nicole Parker, Crista Flanagan, and Ike Barinholtz were all awesome! I highly recommend DISASTER MOVIE!!!!

It's a tragedy that movies like these are made that ruin the good name of its predecessors. The Wayans brothers started an excellent movie franchise with hilarious jokes, actual jokes, at this point it has just been massacred by this laziness and poor excuses for humor. I work at a movie theater and have had the misfortune of having to walk into the movie during scenes and having to clean the movie and sit through the credits. I honestly believe that the bloopers are the funniest part of the entire movie. I mean a girl eating glass? Common, how is that funny? This was sad, i feel bad because should a new title making fun of the popular movies of the year come out, and it be spectacular, it will have to put ALL the funny scenes in the commercials to prove that it won't be as horrible as this one.

reviews.review_title: Complete and utter garbage. Avoid it.
reviews.content: The two worst writers of ''Scary movie'' have come up with something extraordinary; ''Disaster movie'', quite possibly the worst movie ever. It's worse than bad, it's Unbelievably bad, and ,above all, UNIMAGINABLY unfunny. It's that bad, it's an insult to filmmaking.When you first see the title, you would think that it's a spoof of disaster movies, like Twister, The day after tomorrow, Titanic, the towering inferno, and others. WRONG. The only things that have anything to do with disasters in the whole movie are a couple of obviously fake plastic asteroids, a lousy GGI tornado and a random freeze(Where did that come from?!). The rest of the movie is spent on unfunny references(not spoofs) of movies like The dark knight, sex and the city, Juno, High school musical, Alvin and the chipmunks, Batman, Don't mess with the zohan, Kung-fu Panda, Beowulf, The love guru, and celebrities like Hannah Montana, Michael Jackson, Matt Damon, Jessica Simpson, Amy winehouse, and many others.The humour is amazingly stupid and so immature that I doubt even a five year old would find it even remotely funny. When the movie makers does attempt to actually make a joke about something, they repeat the joke a trillion times, and, worst of all, they actually EXPLAIN the jokes and why they are supposed to be funny. Horrible.The acting is so bad that it does'nt deserve to be called acting. The directing seems nonexistent and the script is a total mess with nothing even mildly intelligent in it. I actually felt physically sick while watching this and it's a wonder that I watched through it without getting brain damage.Avoid this pathetic garbage at all costs. -10000000000/10.

Many critics thought that the latest spoof flick "Disaster Movie" was a total disaster. I am not too far off from that school of critical thought, but we all shall not assess into the disaster too seriously. Take it for what it is- a spoof film that does not prioritize on plot premise but on spoof comedy delivery. We gotta plethora of films and characters being parodied here: Amy Winehouse, Juno, Iron Man, The Incredible Hulk, Enchanted, High School Musical, Sex and The City and an avalanche of others. My personal favorite was the Juno one! It impregnated me to tears from laughing! Other mimics were minimally funny while others did get my chuckles to materialize. "Disaster Movie" will not be a total cinematic natural disaster but it will not be your fall comedic savior either. *** Average

yay first review shame it cant be for a good movie just got back from seeing this film and only 2 minutes in i realised that this was going to be a waste of 5 pounds it started and i was thinking oh well maybe it will get better...i was wrong the title disaster movie could only possibly be referring to itself as none of the films i saw could possible be described as disasters the references made to movies were usually just copied straight from the advert and made next to no sense even if the movies referenced were disasters it makes no sense that Amy Winehouse and Micheal Jackson were featured as i do not recall them being in any movies that i know of.in short poorly written poorly acted poor humour poor movie

reviews.review_title: Probably the worse movie I've seen
reviews.content: So after watching Epic movie, I figured Seltzer and Friedberg couldn't write anything worse. I was wrong. This movie was poorly written, the comedy sketches in it were played out and too long. They don't know how to end a joke, they take it and run it so far into the ground, there's no digging it out. They should do everyone in Hollywood a favor by taking Seltzer and Friedberg and ban them from movies completely. After watching that movie I thought i must have tripped something really bad, but wondered what happened to my time that was wasted on this movie. I couldn't even laugh it was so bad. I have seen some really bad movies but they will get me to laugh but this one was far worse. I think i rather watch Crossroads and Kazaam back to back with no breaks then to watch this movie again. They sing in this movie which is fine but end the joke and song, not keep it together for almost 6 minutes. And the song at the end of the movie, whats the point, just roll your credits and walk with your head down in shame. I will have to recommend everyone NOT to watch this movie, unless you want to lose 90 minutes of your life. Anyone that liked this movie, I feel sorry for, and I have a great sense of humor, but this was just purely awful.PLEASE BAN SELTZER AND FRIEDBERG FROM Hollywood!!!

reviews.review_title: The Zucker / Abrahams films were, at least some time, really funny. But that's it?
reviews.content: He's beginning to look less and less like a satire, or something with his own real comic identity, and more and more like a straightforward humorless knockoff, a generic can of "own brand" grocery beans. It is like a Fine Fare Cola celluloid bottle. Disaster Movie, like everyone else, provides a low-rent reminder of successful box office films and popular American TV.And, well, it's fairly much that. It's not limited to disaster movies as such (which wouldn't matter if it's funny), but the audience is obviously expected to point and laugh at just recognizing, say, Wolf from American Gladiators, or at least the actor got up to look like him.All too often there is no real joke in attendance, although I admit that Crista Flanagan provides the pregnant Ellen Page in Juno a shrewd impression.Of course, most British viewers will not recognize solely American television references, and we, the culturally oppressed, may incidentally resent an American actor pretending to be Amy Winehouse with a limey-speaking accent on "drinking petrol." What to drink? The Zucker / Abrahams films were, at least some time, really funny. But that's it?

reviews.review_title: A brilliant juxtaposition between amazing and awesome
reviews.content:
I've seen Cloud Atlas...BORING...Inception? I fell asleep in the first ten minutes...Citizen Kane? Yawnarama...But, then I had the great opportunity to see this masterpiece of cinema! I thought to myself; Is this Kubrick's lost movie? Is this a collaboration between Coppola, Scorsese and Spielberg?
I have never cried, laughed, was terrified, depressed, joyous or triumphant like I was, watching this movie...Throw away your DVD's , Cancel your cable, gather your friends together and bask in the wondrous, Nay, Godsent, homage to human existence. Your life will be fulfilled. That empty feeling; Gone forever...I only wish I could be lashed to a chair for eternity watching this movie~ a tear~

reviews.review_title: You're dang right it's a disaster!
reviews.content: I am going to put as little effort into writing a review for Disaster Movie as Friedberg and Seltzer put into making it.Kim Kardashian. Actress. Enough is said.Carmen Electra. Cat fight with Kim Kardashian. More than enough is said.Opens with a scene of Amy Winehouse chugging a big bottle of vodka and burping loudly in a man's face for about two minutes.Racist, misogynistic, homophobic, all around asinine anti-jokes abound.The Juno parody. Apparently wire hanger abortions, punching pregnant women in the stomach, fetal alcohol syndrome, and the act of defeating your enemies by shooting them with breast milk are hilarious to these guys.There is a parody of High School Musical so excruciating to watch you'll beg to watch the original with Zac Efron again.The CGI isn't even film student quality. Seriously. I saw better CGI on my high school TV station. The pop culture gags feel dead on arrival.These jerks clearly have no understanding of the stuff they're spoofing.To them, all of us are philistines who are incapable of appreciating humor greater than a fart joke.As a lover of all things cinema, Disaster Movie is depressing to watch. Friedberg and Seltzer cannot write their way out of a bag, yet they somehow keep getting work. Taking into account how many people in showbiz are struggling to make ends meet, that's disgusting. The fact that hacks like Friedberg and Seltzer are still working makes me want to bring back the blacklist.I would much rather bathe in acid than ever watch anything by these two royal fools ever again.**Originally from my film blog**

reviews.review_title: Well, at least the title of this "movie" is honest.....
reviews.content: "Disaster Movie" (2008), wow. As if the existence of "Epic Movie" (2007) wasn't bad enough! It seems that these "film makers" haven't learned their lesson after the first "movie". This "film", once again, has a lazy pointless story, terrible acting, cheesy special effects, dull sets/locations, and finally a cliched generic boring soundtrack to tie this diarrhea stain together. The story, or lack thereof, is just a cliched plethora of subplots with a cliched boring narrative and cliched snore fest that goes absolutely nowhere, again. Now, I do like the parody genre when it's executed properly. But, this "film" is anything but well executed! This "movie" has some of the worst direction that I have ever seen. Keep in mind, this "movie" has two directors. Yet, they still somehow screwed it up, again! How is that possible?! "Cannonball Run" franchise, eat your heart out! When I was putting my list of the top 10 worst movies I have ever seen, I was debating whether to go with this one, or "Epic Movie". By a slight margin, this one was a little better. That's not saying much! The only moment I enjoyed was the Chipmunks getting crushed at the end. I hate "Alvin and the Chipmunks"! As far as the acting goes, it is just as dreadful, as the first "film"! Most of the so-called "performances" are so bad, that it leads you to question: "what were you thinking?!" Or another question, "what kind of direction were the actors and actresses given?" As for the special effects, the majority of them look cheesy and generic. Therefore, the special effects have not aged well. The sets/locations look dull and boring, and most of the interior scenes were obviously filmed in a studio. Finally, the musical score is boring, predictable and forced. No part of the score is memorable at all. "Disaster Movie" (which it is), certainly lives up to it's title. It is, without a doubt, one of the worst movies I have ever seen, it actually was a contender for my top 10 worst movies list, but didn't quite reach the mark. Still, there is nothing positive I can salvage from this waste of film making. I'm giving this "film" 0 out of 5 stars on my scale. If I could rate it 0 stars I would, but 1 is as low as I can go. Ignore the 1 star rating, my true rating is 0 stars. The only positive thing I can gather from watching this "movie", like most other bad movies I've seen, is that I'll never have to watch it again. Stay away from "Disaster Movie", trust me, it is the epitome of a disaster!

reviews.review_title: I walked out after 10 minutes, and damn happy I did!!!!
reviews.content: To say this is one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my young life is a huge understatement. To put it more clearly, this absolutely WAS the worst movie I have ever seen in my life! Me and a buddy had heard how terrible it was, and I was truly curious, thinking, "Nothing tops Epic Movie. That was horrible!" So we went to see it. Hoo boy, was I WRONG!!! First off, nothing within the 10 minutes I saw was remotely funny, or even somewhat entertaining, just a bunch of pop culture references and movies that had nothing to do with disaster (maybe the horribly fake meteorites in the beginning, but since I walked out after 10 minutes, i don't know if there were others). I didn't even remotely get why "my super sweet 16" was being spoofed when the title was DISASTER MOVIE. What the hell?! The movie was titled disaster movie, but I believe the title would be more appropriate if it was "Randomly Throw in Irrelevant Pop Culture References and Movies that Have Nothing to Do With Disaster Movies" Movie, since thats all that I got when we walked out after 10 minutes. I honestly felt dumber to say the least, but at least guy selling tickets was nice enough to give me my money back, thank god! My advice: STAY AWAY. STAY FAR FAR AWAY!!! Iwouldn't go back to see this garbage even if somebody paid me, its that bad!

When will they stop? Not content with Scary Movies 1-500,000, Not Another Teen Movie, Date Movie, Epic Movie, Superhero Movie and Meet The Spartans, Hollywood has churned out Disaster Movie - another 'comedic spoof' of the year's biggest blockbusters - which for the most part were decent films; and in some cases Oscar winners: No Country for Old Men and Juno for example.So why spoof popular films? They were popular for a reason; and were, for he most part 1000 times better than this lazy, half-finished old horse tripe.The fundamental flaw of Disaster Movie is that it's just not funny. Having Princess Gizelle from 'Enchanted' eating glass for example is not only disgusting but also cynical and in the worst possible taste, and then there's the film's attempts to be topical, by having Amy Winehouse spring up from out of a bush drinking Whisky and talking of 'having gasoline' which 'was good' - surely the potentially fatal drink and drug problems of such a famous person is not something to flippantly joke about, and more to the point - unashamedly cash in on; as Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer have.There is no plot to this film - people run around on the 29th August - as I said, not a plot, and because of this Disaster, ahem Movie (can it really be called a movie?) feels like one and a half hours of ear-bleedingly, eye-wateringly unfunny outtakes, which by the end makes one wish that like Iron Man, The Hulk and Hellboy, a cow would fall from the sky, and crush one to death.Give the £5.20 ticket price for this film to charity instead.0/10 (If only IMDb let you score that)

I've always been a big fan of IMDb & have rated tons of movies I have seen; although I've never written a review on one. I decided to watch this movie knowing it would be stupid based on ratings but figured it would be a 'funny' (i.e. Scary Movie) type of stupid. Boy was I wrong. I do not recall even laughing one time. I've seen some bad movies in my time but I would have to say this is the worst of the worst. I do not recommend even bothering to watch it and I thank God that I didn't pay to see it. Horrible.I normally always give a movie a try regardless of ratings. This is one time I should have listened and stayed away. I just wasted 88 minutes of my life on this one. Would have just turned it off but I kept saying it will get better lol. It didn't./i3luechaos\

reviews.review_title: Despite the reviews here, I really enjoyed this film
reviews.content: No, it's not a Cannes Film Festival official selection, nor will you see it on the roster of Berlin or Venice or San Sebastian, but for all you film critics you are disecting this film as if it was an art house flick, you need to lighten up! Is the movie stupidly dumb, yes...at times, is it incoherent...yup, is it offensive? if you cant appreciate the brand of humor...hmm..yeah probably, but does it do what it was meant to do? Most definitely. I laughed my ass off and I seriously did not know what to expect. Granted I laughed for a lot of different reason. First the set up and akwardness of some of the scenes, the FUNNY MOMENTS, because yes it did have some very funny moments that had me laughing out loud. But all in all I enjoyed the film for what it was. All you film critics here need to get off your high horse and sit back and see it for what it is... brainless entertainment. For me I left my baggage at the door and went for the ride. I left the theatre feeling lighter than when I went it so for me, it did do what it was set out to do.

The movie is the disaster as is American baseless culture.
dumb, not funny

reviews.review_title: This movie SUCKS SO MUCH it's a pill of S***
reviews.content: This movie is terrible the actors SUCK at acting the only good part is when Nikki manage DIED and there is absolutely no plot just don't watch it I BEG of you

I put this movie on while I was just sitting around to try it out but it really is as bad as others say. Every "joke:" is forced and not funny.
If you wanna watch a movie to see just how bad a movie can be...here you go.This doesn't even deserve a 1, at least Sharknado, Sharktopus etc movies are so bad, they are great...this movie is just bad.

reviews.review_title: Some laugh-out-loud moments if you enjoy stupid humor
reviews.content: This review is not going to tell you anything you care too much about. By now, most people know the formula that has gone from Date Movie to Epic Movie to Meet the Spartans, and now Disaster Movie. But unlike Meet the Spartans, Disaster Movie actually doesn't COMPLETELY suck.Okay, so I will definitely admit that the first ten minutes of this film completely turned me off. There really isn't much grounds for spoofing 10,000 B.C., and the direction they went was just completely ridiculous. But as the movie goes on and scene after scene is some sort of witty reference, it gets considerably better, especially when all the side characters start coming in. There was actually quite a few sequences that had me laughing out loud, namely one spoofing the 'Head On' commercial and another which mocks the lyrics of a song in Juno.There's nothing new to be found in Disaster Movie, but maybe that's why I saw it. I was just looking to be entertained, and while the first fifteen minutes or so were quite atrocious, it got better toward the middle, and let up to a somewhat satisfying conclusion. Some of the jokes fall flat, certainly, and a lot of them even drag on for too long, but I cannot bring myself to say that I didn't enjoy this movie.I'm really not sure of the reason why I enjoyed it so much, but I think it was mostly due to the fact that I went in with an open mind and I found myself laughing a lot, along with the group of friends I went with. Not everyone will love the movie, but there is plenty to laugh at. There are a few shining moments, and they pretty much more than make up for the really crappy ones. Juno, Enchanted, and Sex and the City probably got the cleverest spoofs, and I really liked the mockery of the quippy Juno dialogue. Matt Lanter was a great lead, and Kim Kardashian was pretty funny in her role. Overall, not a terrible movie, and really quite entertaining, especially all the musical scenes.
Atrocious writing, directing, characters, acting, jokes and every single moment of this film.

Its almost as if somebody put a gun to the script writer's head, game him a list of movies and said "I want a spoof of these movies.. NOW" When I went to see the disaster movie, I wasn't expecting much since I had seen "The Spartans" and seeing as how that movie was pathetic...From start to end, this movie tries to spoof anything and everything to do with celebrity mess ups. There's Amy Winehouse, Hannah Montana even a fleeting reference to Brangelina.. Its all been there, seen that kinda stuff. None of the gags amused me since most of it was predictable. Gone are the days when people made good spoofs like Airplane, Hot Shots, etc.I suggest that if you've got an hour and a half of your life to spare, don't waste it on this bomb.

reviews.review_title: This one was the best of the bunch
reviews.content: Ever year, I sucker myself into seeing these "Movie" movies, and I've walked out on two of them already (Epic Movie and Meet The Spartans). But I hate to say it (and I really do hate to say it) that I enjoyed Disaster Movie. It was not a perfect comedy at all, and maybe my expectations ran low, but I actually laughed at a lot of this. I think the writers took a route this time of less cringe and more dialog development (yes, I mean that). Seems the characters in this film are taking a moment or two to react to what's going on around them, and the reaction dialog helped the comedy immensely. Overall, I was just glad I didn't feel compelled to walk out again.

Don't listen to the bad reviews. The only people writing them are people this movie is not targeted for. Those wanting some serious movie with a firm plot need to get lost, because that's obviously not what this is. Like really? If you don't like spoof movies then just don't watch them. Common sense huh? I thought this was pretty funny, leave your brain at the doorstep and go into this just for the fun of it, unless you're a prude just wanting something to hate.

Seriously. Don't see it, don't rent it, don't even download it. Wipe it from your memory.This tripe is beyond low budget. It's as if Lion's Gate rented out a camera with a "Insert 25 cents for 10 minutes" slot on the side, then the director walked over to the first empty field he could find and shot a movie.After all salaries were paid, it's doubtful that $10,000 was even spent on the movie, and probably millions were spent on advertising it. Does the studio, producers, and writers really and truly believe that civilization is utterly stupid so as not to see that they were obviously TRYING to make a horrible movie?Rodriguez + $5,000 = El MariachiThese people + $10,000 = vomit splattered on a public toilet.Epic fail & not worth the effort of filming.

Of all the cringe movies I had to go through, Disaster Movie is the worst out of all of them! The duo behind this trash didn't even bother watching the films they were spoofing and so forced them to fighting the main cast naked or just straight up killing them! I am glad that Matt Latner's role as Anakin Skywalker made him recover from starring in the pits of heck you call a movie! Disaster Movie should be recycled so the end would never happen.

Before seeing this movie i was convinced no movie could ever be more awful than Simon Sez (dennis rodman). But disaster movie lives up to its name and claims first position in my bottom 100 list. People who rate this movie above 4 out of 10 should be taken to a mental hospital immediately for a lobotomy. The script seems to be written by a 12 year old with a very disturbed brain. The only spoof targets should be the actors and the directors themselves, making fun of other movies and creating the worst movie ever made in the process is quite painful. Friedberg and Seltzer, shame on you. Trowing garbage like that into the world. Unbelievable that the movies you made open close to number one at the box office. Making movies for very dumb people or horny teens isn't that hard to do i guess, trow in the occasional boob or fart and they're satisfied...

Been coming to IMDb since, well, since it has existed. This is the first time I have felt compelled to comment on ANY movie.The reason: The worst movie ever that had any kind of budget! I love spoof movies and will sit through a stinker if it has at least one good belly laugh.Example: Repossessed was a dud but had one good laugh in the opening scene.Worth the time to me.These guys had money and talent at their disposal, and they disposed of it! I could have written a better movie.After reading many of the comments, I thought that there was no way that they could put together a movie without at least one good laugh.I was wrong!!! I hope the makers of this film have made their last movie. They have squandered whatever credibility they may have had.They could have taken cuts from the movies they spoofed and added comments and it would have been better than this crap.Pass on this movie!

reviews.review_title: I registered just to say how SH*T it is
reviews.content: Ever feel like you've been cheated? You will if you watch this movieDon't see this movie unless you want to waste your time or want to have a peaceful sleep in the theatre (because no one will be there). It is by far the stupidest, lamest, most lazy, and unbelievably UNFUNNY movie I have ever seen. The title was absolutely right it's a total disaster movie!!You can't say it has bad acting, because there is NO acting. You can't say it has bad writing, because it has NO original writing. You can't say it has bad cinematography, because there is NO cinematography. You can't say it's a bad movie, BECAUSE THERE IS NO MOVIE! i really like watch the other movies like scary movie one and two but this is!!! never again.

reviews.review_title: this is the worst movie i've ever seen.
reviews.content: and i'm not exaggerating. there is no plot whatsoever all it is is a bunch of stupid parodies on pop culture that aren't even funny. the only people laughing in the theater when i saw it were kids that were 13 and under.please, i'm begging you, jason friedberg and aaron seltzer. if you read this, get it through your heads that the steamy piles of crap that you keep producing are not funny.stop making movies, buy a house with the money you've made, and never come out again.everything you guys make is garbage.

reviews.review_title: i hate so much this movie that i put on my list of worst movies of all time
reviews.content:
"OH MY GOD! WHAT MY EYES HAVE SEEN!! PLEASE,JUST PUT ME ON A HOSPITAL AND SAVE ME OF THIS MOVIE!!!"
no,serious,what did i just watch
this movie deserves its own title, "Disaster Movie"
if you like this movie,you have serious problems.
I enjoyed watching the movie, but it is obvious from its name and poster that it is a terrible movie. I don't regret watching :)

This movie was certainly a surprise....only to me. I watched every spoof movie that came out since Scary Movie and this one is clever and ranks near the top....with a 5/10. The Scary Movie films were much better than this movie while Meet the Spartans is possibly the worst spoof ever made.As with most spoof movies, there is no need to describe the plot. The main storyline/spoof is based on Cloverfield. Other movies thrown into spoof mode are Indiana Jones, Iron Man, Batman, Juno, Alvin and the Chipmunks, and Hannah Montana. Almost none of these films are disaster movies, just to let you know.There are some strong points and weak, disastrous points. The 10,000 BC and Amy Winehouse jokes sucked. The Alvin and the Chipmunks and Indiana Jones scenes are funny. I also agree with most people that the Hannah Montana scenes were annoying.There are some great actors in here. I liked Matt Lanter and the queen of spoof movies, Carmen Electra.There was a good effort by the makers of this film. There is not enough to warrant many laughs. I can see why over 80% of the comment writers voted a 1 for this film. I rate this film 5/10.

reviews.review_title: You got that right! Disaster Movie, a truly Disaster
reviews.content: I guess that losing the money and the time isn't enough, I felt so embarrassed that I flushed and I had to leave the theater I couldn't take it anymore, And I still can't , please don't show this movie anymore all of those "jokes" I've heard them like a million times my grandma could write better comedy lines while cookingdon't even read this review everything about or related to this movie, is a disaster for a better future, may this be the last time we heard about this movie please, no more

To think this movie was called 'Disaster Movie', because of 'all the parodies on disaster movies', is a mistake. This movie is called that way, because the movie itself is a disaster. From the moment the movie begins, everything the main cast is doing is one long concatenation of silly, overdone parodies on a wide selection of movies. A couple of parodies are okay, but they just keep on coming and even if you think that a parodie is going to stop, so they could continue with 'the story' of the movie...think again. Some parodies are hugely overdone and way too much. And that's not all. What bothers me, is that a lot of the parodies and spoofs are from quite new movies, which are hard to get and left you wondering what the movie was called again that they are spoofing. To spoof instant classics like Star Wars and Indiana Jones is okay, because everyone gets that...but to spoof Zohan and Jimmy Kimmel show (just to name two)...that's just not done. And the list continues....there are about 60 spoofs and connections with other movies...which are just 50 too many. (I think I could stand 10 spoofs, but not more!). Verdict: This 'disaster-on-screen' is not worth watching and especially not worth your money if you want to rent it. 2 out of 10. Yes, I gave it a 2 because of the cool metal/hardrock song that's in the movie. Don't watch the movie for that part, it should be on YouTube somewhere. Saves you about an hour of your life.

It takes a certain kind of humor and a certain kind of understanding of satire as well as current pop culture and current films to understand these kinds of films.I thought Date Movie was great, Epic Movie wonderful, Meet the Spartans terrific and I found myself enjoying Disaster movie. While it isn't as funny as some of the earlier films nor is the cast as good as the earlier films, it's still pretty good.Bear in mind that this is not your average film. You CANNOT treat it as such, have intense expectations, get disappointed, come online and badmouth the film. As I said before, this film is loaded with satire. It's also loaded with slapstick.There were two instances of the film that I felt kind of dragged on: a)the musical scene where the high school group was singing during the Cloverfield knock off and b)the whole Hannah Montana being crushed under the meteor.The best part was, in my opinion, when Carmen Electra wrestled Lisa. Just to watch them wrestle was well worth going out to the movies. And I really liked the Enchanced bit where the girl jumps out of the sewer and lands on the black dude's balls (yep, he sings about it).I found myself constantly laughing and laughing during this film. It's slapstick and satire: the movie plot really doesn't have to make sense. As long as you understand the gist of where each scene is coming from, what message the writers are trying to convey and then watch how they're presenting it, you'll laugh.One last thing, the chipmunk bit was so wicked! I hope the DVD is loaded with unrated extras that were chopped out of the movie.Because I can appreciate this kind of a film, 8/10. Not bad, not bad at all!

In all my time I don't think I've ever given anything below a 3/10 for a film....until now.Watched it purely to see if it was that bad, and trust me it really was! Random crappy joke after random crappy joke that had nothing to do with the storyline, if you can call it that, is all this film had. I watched a "dodgy" version of this and there were actually people laughing in the background at a quite a lot of this, I dread to think how they found any humour in it.Seriously cannot understand how people are allowed to produce this sort of crap, and even more baffled by how so many people actually pay to view it.1.5/10 And that's me being generous.

reviews.review_title: Number 25 On The Worst Movies Of All Time List?
reviews.content: Yes. This movie was very very stupid. The plot was retarded. They poked fun of so many real movies. I am mad that they gave Souljah Boy some more publicity by poking fun of his dance in this movie. The person who created this movie is obsessed with naked people and men dressing like women. And the profanity in this movie was outrageous! But there were a handful of funny scenes. It took a lot of creativity to make this movie. Where did they find professional dancers to perform the High School Musical spoof? I have seen movies much worse than this. I know this movie was horrible, but I don't think it should have been on the bottom 100 list.

I don't usually review anything, but this film is so bad that i felt i had to tell everyone i could and this seemed the best way to do it.I have never been a fan of the "Movie" films that have been coming out non-stop for the last 9 years, as i don't think any of them are even remotely funny, the films have no story, make no sense and the gags are almost all the same.This reaches a new level mediocrity however. The title bears no resemblance to disaster style films at all, other than one poke at twister. The whole film consists of bad impressions of superheroes, celebrities and other movies like juno, indiana jones and the incredible hulk.In summary, they really need to stop making these "movies". They are outdated and unoriginal now.If Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer are reading "PLEASE STOP WASTING YOUR TIME AND YOUR MONEY".It's just not funny anymore and hasn't been in a long, long time!!

How can anybody enjoy these? The directors of this movie were so bad that they were ripping off movies that were still in theaters! That's the lamest idea I've ever heard. That means all they did to write the movie was watch other movies' trailers and try to crack jokes on them. That's not clever, that's just lazy.These movies are made cheap ($20 million budget, which is really really low in 2012) just so the studios can make a quick cash-in on teenagers and twenty-somethings who will laugh at anything. Don't be a sucker for these guys. Stay away from these Seltzer and Friedberg movies. Watch something with some creativity.

reviews.review_title: Why is this movie getting so much hate?
reviews.content: This movie was on Hulu and I saw if was from the very talented people, Jason Freidberg and Aaron seltzer. The ones who made epic movie and meet the Spartans. So I knew it had to be good. Point is it blew my expectations away. The comedy is so on point and the story was the best I have seen ever. But I haven't even gotten to the acting it was sooo good especially the guy who got cast for like 7 different roles, I thought he was great. I give it and 11/10 and recommend it to anyone who even knows what a movie even is,Of corse this is fake my real review would give it a 0 out of 10 if it was an option the story sucked the acting was terrible the story made NO sense, the effects looked like they were from an elementary school play. This is a racist, sexist, piece of unfunny trash.wuch should not be viewed BY ANYONE. The only reason I watched this was because I lost a bet and decided to write a review.

#1 on the bottom list? You've got to be kidding me! I agree this wasn't any type of entertainment, but I have seen movies that were a lot worse: Epic Movie, as one example. Okay, so here's the reason I watched this movie. I had enjoyed Meet the Spartans, but had hated Epic Movie. I decided to watch this film to see if this could be any good, and frankly, it was pretty bad. It's almost like...an Epic Movie clone. ALMOST! Epic movie was 1000000000000000000000 times worse, but here's what the main problem with those movies are: THEY DON'T HAVE ANY PLOT! All they (Seltzer & Friedberg) do is take a piece of paper, make a ''script'' out of dumb gags that involve the main characters of REAL movies like Hancock, Hellboy and Batman and get them crushed by random objects like cows from the sky or get overrun by cars. But I most admit that this movie was so stupid that towards the end, I laughed a little bit. Just a little.But please, Aaron and Jason, stop making those movies. I heard you were going to make Invasion movie. Hope it ends there.

The worst movie ever created
Nothing more needs to be said except from do not waste your time.Can't believe people actually paid to see this movie.Absolute trash.

This movie is completely awful. The humour reaches a point where one can describe it as worse than childish. The actors untalented, or unwilling to even try and the parody parts are just too offensive and unfunny to be even considered parody. There's absolutely no point in watching that movie. I would only beg the producers and the director to stop wasting money for making this kind of rubbish. There are a lot of good movies made with half the budget 'Disaster Movie' had. I advise you not to watch it ever. Don't waste your time on this movie. Is mocking a dwarf funny? Or humiliating a troubled singer with addiction? No. It is absolutely not. The only thing good about it is it's title. Disaster indeed.
The average score speaks for itself. It's not funny. It's poorly acted. The script makes you cringe instead of laugh. Nothing good comes of this.

Today I decided to watch a movie since I had a lot of spare time today, I chose Disaster Movie because I was in the mood for a giggle. Unfortunately, I didn't laugh, instead I cringed at the awful acting, seriously terrible humour and pretty much everything! This pile of rubbish is WORSE than Epic Movie!To be honest, I think Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg let Year Seven students write the script for this torture method!
What does Amy Winehouse have to do with disaster movies? What does Juno have to do with disaster movies? WHAT DOES HIGH SCHOOL MUSICAL HAVE TO DO WITH FREAKING DISASTER MOVIES?!When I got to the 25th minute mark, I couldn't take it anymore so I decided to turn it off which was a shame because this was the first movie I've stopped watching. I just couldn't bear the torture anymore...If you see this movie on DVD somewhere, don't pick it up, it's not worth it. Don't watch this on TV when there's nothing else on.

reviews.review_title: a very good way to lose weight
reviews.content: I saw this movie yesterday morning, it was just stupid, lame, unfunny, but most of all disgusting. After I saw it, i was so disgusted that i couldn't eat for the rest of the day. so, am going to see it frequently and i guess it will be the best way ever to lose weight, after u see this movie, the sight of any kind of food makes u want to vomit, and u cant even drink water. this movie is recommended for anybody who wants to be thin, u don't need any diet, just see this movie. It's also recommended for people with low blood pressure, u'll be amazed how high ur blood pressure is after viewing this. anorexic people , or over 40 with high blood pressure, u should avoid it at all costs

I watched this movie a few years ago, what I was not expecting was a movie that was full of horrible jokes aswell as acting and CGI that belonged to a school project, I know its supposed to be a comedy movie, but this is not even funny, stay away and dont even try to give it a go.

reviews.review_title: It is good if you want to torture someone
reviews.content: Tie someone in a chair,put this movie at TV, and force that person to watch.When that person is watching it, he/she will probably have a cerebral hemorrhage,or will have an epilepsy at how bad this movie is.Works 100%. Trust me.

Definitely not the best movie I have ever seen but still entertaining if you don't take it as seriously as some viewers are pretending to. I mean it's a parody movie called "disaster movie", so don't expect something smart. Expect something more along the lines of someone farting on you: try to tell me that's not funny. The comedy lies in how stupid and absurd it is. Irrelevant jokes that go nowhere but still make you smile a little, odd references, crazy cameos, movies upon movies parodied to the maximum. I don't understand the hate. Just try to enjoy it and you might. Watch it to hate and you might. I appreciate the goofyness. Maybe you will too.

reviews.review_title: i found a positive aspect in this movie...
reviews.content: I was definitely expecting a bad movie ..and i got one! from the comedy aspect (the genre it is accidentally addressed to) it was even worse than "Meet the Spartans" and the...forgot the name of that movie.. it was about..o, remembered! - "dragonfly". So - about comedy aspect - there is none... or one. I had something similar to a laugh just once while watching the movie, once!! this is a new anti-record for these type of movies. I am really waiting in excitement what will be the next BIG THING that Hollyywood will bring in this terrible-parody sub genre (i am not kidding, for real!) So that's about the comedy aspect of "Disaster Movie" (this is where it got it's 0.5 mark out of 10). now to the positive thing i mentioned in the headline - this movie can be used as a reference guide to the top hit movies of this year and those that can be put on to-watch list. It's more like an hour long ad, than a movie. And some parody scenes are quite good example/interpretations of pop-life based events for the last-and-past years. And this is where it gets another mark - i even give one whole point out of 10 (now totaling 1,5/10).Thrully disastrous movie, but it's what you asked for if you wanted to watch it ;)PS. where did it get the last 0.5points? for the ending song which is a rather good parody for the default pop songs that engulf the charts.
If you like the other movie movies, you should like this one. Very ridiculous, but very enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: What people say are right, and I regret watching it
reviews.content:
I never know there will be a movie like this. Worst movie I ever watch. What people say are right. I should listen to them.
At least I watch this in 2020 for free 😂

reviews.review_title: I hated every second of it
reviews.content: Did not go in with that high expectations but still...i was wondering how bad could it even get...very bad. I regret all the time spent watching this. The movie has no comedy in it whatsoever. Everything in it is too cheesy to even be able to comprehend what is happening. It is, with no doubt, a disaster movie. At least the title is well deserved...right?

reviews.review_title: An open letter to these two filmmakers
reviews.content: This isn't so much a review of the film, Which I did go see, and I did run out and hug a tree after, but more a open letter to the two film con artist that made it and the others like it. I don't write on these message boards or do any kind of reviews, because for the most part, I love watching movies. This summer has been the best for movies in a long time. Even movies that didn't live up to the hype, I found something enjoyable in them. But, In watching this latest movie that these two came out with, I had to think, "Do they even care?" why would you two try and at least write a funny joke? Parodies are hard to do. But, when done right, Like Scary Movie, Airplane, Top gun, (add your favorite here) you can not only laugh yourself into a coma, you can also see the hard work that went into them. Hard work that Jason and Arron know nothing about. They think, as long as young people go see them, Then they'll keep making them. So, here is what I would like to say to you Jason and Arron -- If you really did have anything to do with scary movie like you make everyone think you did, then you would step up and accept this challenge. If by some insane chance, that any studio would ever allow you to make another movie, Do what others have done with "Scary Movie" go out and get good writers who will bust their asses to make a movie that you can be proud of. Take all the money you've made off of these Unfunny things that you call movies and pay good writers to help you.I challenge you to do this. I know you love movies. You have to. So, try and make a good one.Thanks for the garbage.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies ever -an embarrassment to humans ,what the heck is this awful crap?.....
reviews.content: Well ,after watching this for checking out if it's as bad as reviews are saying I was terribly shocked by the simple fact of why did people wanted to make this movie in the first place -and well ,it's way waaaay worse then what the hating reviews are saying.Pluse ,it's incredibly stupid- pure stupidity ,an insult to human civilization along with awful direction and acting. It was so horrible that it had absolutely no plot nor a logic sequence of events not mentioning the bad cast (Paris Hilton ,Kim Kardashian ,and Carmen Electra are already awful enough...) and the fact that the movie just can't be a parody to single other movie or TV show -it's just can't decide what kind of jokes and humor it has (what the hell does TV shows and movies like Alvin & The Chipmunks or Juno got to do with disasters?...!?!! it was unbelievably unfunny ,there wasn't even one single funny joke....).And besides, the characters were incredibly stupid and non of them was really interesting nor had any personality at all -not mentioning the fact that the movie was simply too long and dragged like a real train wreck of stupidity meltdown coming out of everyone involved in making this awful crap /garbage.In conclusion: an all new low ,unfunny and pathetic piece of crap ,total rot ,pure garbage ,total crapfest -awful beyond any words ,just avoid it!!!.

Unfortunately for this movie, the A-holes from the production team that planted "good reviews" about this movie on here are not enough to save it from officially being the IMDb worst movie of all time. May it rot in hell at #1 forever.Nothing in these movies is the least bit entertaining. If any of the people who gave this movie positive reviews actually enjoyed it, I truly feel sorry for you. Lionsgate should be ashamed for putting this garbage in theaters, and the two idiot writer/producer wannabes should take their millions and disappear, and save us from any more torture.There's nothing to actually review about this movie. It goes from one stupid, completely non-funny scene to another. Please do not even pay to see this movie to see how horrible it is. If 9 out of 10 people see this movie to "see how dumb it is" then that's more than enough for them to keep making this garbage. It's sad when a movie is so stupid that making fun of it is not even enjoyable.
Oh my god, this film is bad. It's full of cliches and atrocious acting. DO NOT WATCH
Even as a spoof, even as a bad spoof this scrapes the bottom. Teeth grindingly tedious - flat one liners- a mush mash of familiar movies - it's just so bad.

Disaster movie is the worst movie I ever seen in my entire life. The burping lady made me laugh at first but it got boring really quickly.
What were they thinking?

'Date Movie' was good, 'Epic Movie was OK',and 'Meet the Spartans was decent.The one thing that these movies have in common is that they all received horrible,and I mean HORRIBLE,reviews.But Why?I found them a little enjoyable,even though they had scenes that really didn't belong in the first place.But 'Disaster Movie'is probably the worst film from Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.I'm not saying that I wasted money when I went to see the movie in the theater,I'm just saying that this movie had some parts that completely wasted my time.For example,there's a scene that spoofs 'High School Musical.'The one problem with that scene is that it was too long.The characters couldn't sing or dance,so they should've left the original movie by itself,or the scene could've been cut short.Overall,this is an OK movie that I would probably skip if I were you if I would be looking for a very funny movie.C-

reviews.review_title: If 30,000 voted for this - it must have been worth their time!!
reviews.content: This has to be the most excellent film ever made. I mean to have to bother to write all these negatives must have had some impact on the audience. The film is a simple imitation of the original films and needs to be watched at face value!! I am sure my full score will not impact the over all score , but watch this film drunk and laugh away! Or albeit, be happy with the trailer! Not sure I can fill in ten lines here, so I will just say, if you know what you like watch it and if not...don't! God Bless The World.
